finish().Description: Finish and close this action mode. The action mode's @B_android#support#v7#view#ActionMode#Callback_E@ will have its @B_android#support#v7#view#ActionMode#Callback#onDestroyActionMode_E@ method called.

invalidate().Description: Invalidate the action mode and refresh menu content. The mode's @B_android#support#v7#view#ActionMode#Callback_E@ will have its @B_android#support#v7#view#ActionMode#Callback#onPrepareActionMode_E@ method called. If it returns true the menu will be scanned for updated content and any relevant changes will be reflected to the user.

Parameters: int: Resource ID of a string to set as the title
setTitle(int).Description: Set the title of the action mode. This method will have no visible effect if a custom view has been set.

Returns: true if this action mode considers the title and subtitle fields as optional. Optional titles may not be displayed to the user.

getCustomView().Description: Returns the current custom view for this action mode.

Parameters: int: Resource ID of a string to set as the subtitle
setSubtitle(int).Description: Set the subtitle of the action mode. This method will have no visible effect if a custom view has been set.

getMenuInflater().Description: Returns a @B_android#view#MenuInflater_E@ with the ActionMode's context.

getTitle().Description: Returns the current title of this action mode.

Parameters: Object: Tag to associate with this ActionMode
setTag(java.lang.Object).Description: Set a tag object associated with this ActionMode. Like the tag available to views, this allows applications to associate arbitrary data with an ActionMode for later reference.

Parameters: View: Custom view to use in place of the title/subtitle.
setCustomView(android.view.View).Description: Set a custom view for this action mode. The custom view will take the place of the title and subtitle. Useful for things like search boxes.

getTag().Description: Retrieve the tag object associated with this ActionMode. Like the tag available to views, this allows applications to associate arbitrary data with an ActionMode for later reference.

getSubtitle().Description: Returns the current subtitle of this action mode.

setSubtitle(java.lang.CharSequence).Description: Set the subtitle of the action mode. This method will have no visible effect if a custom view has been set.

setTitle(java.lang.CharSequence).Description: Set the title of the action mode. This method will have no visible effect if a custom view has been set.

Parameters: boolean: true if the title only presents optional information.
setTitleOptionalHint(boolean).Description: Set whether or not the title/subtitle display for this action mode is optional. In many cases the supplied title for an action mode is merely meant to add context and is not strictly required for the action mode to be useful. If the title is optional, the system may choose to hide the title entirely rather than truncate it due to a lack of available space. Note that this is merely a hint; the underlying implementation may choose to ignore this setting under some circumstances.

getMenu().Description: Returns the menu of actions that this action mode presents.

Returns: true if this action mode has been given a hint to consider the title/subtitle display to be optional.

ClassDesc: Represents a contextual mode of the user interface. Action modes can be used to provide alternative interaction modes and replace parts of the normal UI until finished. Examples of good action modes include text selection and contextual actions.
